meanings.definition: The state of being cautious or on guard.
meanings.sent1: Her wariness around strangers kept her safe from harm.
meanings.sent2: His wariness of the dark alley made him walk faster.
meanings.sent3: The cat's wariness of the vacuum cleaner was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The soldier's wariness was a shield against unseen dangers.
meanings.sent5: The child's wariness of the barking dog was palpable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being watchful or alert.
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard's wariness prevented any accidents at the pool.
meanings.sent2: The detective's wariness helped him solve the case quickly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's wariness of the bird feeder was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The captain's wariness guided the ship safely through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's wariness of cheating students never wavered.
